Dave,
In message 804, you were talking about how to use a previous solution 
as the initial guess for the next run.  For solutions saved as xml 
files, you said the following:

Alternatively, if you have a solution that you previously saved to an
xml file using the
command:
flame.save('flame.xml', id = 'firstBC' ).

, you can load the solution into another flame object or the same
using the
commands:
flame2.init()
flame2.restore('flame.xml', id = 'firstBC')

And then change the boundary and operating conditions of this flame
object ("flame2") using
the "set" commands as above.


I am trying to use this for the freely propagating adiabatic flame 
demo on python, but have had no success.  I commented out the 
portions of the demo that solve without the energy equation, and that 
solve with the energy equation on, but with 'mix' transport 
properties, since both are used as initial guesses for solving with 
the 'multi' transport properties.  Where should I put f.init() and 
f.restore?  I placed them after f.inlet.set(), and when I run the 
demo, it appears to load the solution from the previous run, but then 
it just sits there.  I let it run for about two hours before deciding 
to restart the shell (the calculation I ran to get the solution I am 
using as the initial guess took only 5 minutes).  Do you have any 
advice?

Thank you very much,
Jeff Miller
